main event: Sighting of a yellowish-white object with a yellowish trail, observed by ground and air observers in Hutchinson, Kansas on December 10, 1962.
interesting points: The object looked like a streak of light, had no sound or trail, and was observed for about 5 minutes.
The object was seen by three sources: the Hutchinson, Kansas tower, an American Airlines flight, and a Central Airlines flight.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 800-1000 miles per hour, flying in a flat trajectory from west to east.
The object appeared to be 3000-4000 feet above the horizon and faded out after 5-10 seconds.
The report concludes that the sighting was probably a meteor.
sighted object: Yellowish-white object with a yellowish trail
witnesses: Hutchinson tower, American Airlines flight, Central Airlines flight
